title: Creating a reading list of articles on simultaneous translation methods involves selecting a mix of academic papers, conference proceedings, and industry articles. Here’s a list of 20 articles and papers up to 2020 that you might find useful
**"Simultaneous Interpretation: A Cognitive-Pragmatic Analysis"** by Daniel Gile
- Although older, this foundational work provides insights into the cognitive processes involved in simultaneous interpretation
**"The Role of Anticipation in Simultaneous Interpreting"** by Barbara Moser-Mercer (1978) - Discusses the importance of anticipation in the interpreting process
**"Simultaneous Interpretation: A Human Information Processing Perspective"** by David Gerver
- An early exploration of the cognitive aspects of simultaneous interpretation

**"The Effort Models and Hypotheses about the Development of Simultaneous Interpreting"** by Daniel Gile (1997) - Introduces the Effort Models, which are crucial for understanding the cognitive load in interpreting
**"Simultaneous Interpretation: A New Approach"** by Seleskovitch, Danica
- Offers a new perspective on the practice and theory of simultaneous interpretation
**"Simultaneous Interpretation: A Historical Perspective"** by Franz Pöchhacker
- Provides a historical overview of the development of simultaneous interpretation
**"Cognitive Load in Simultaneous Interpreting: Measures and Methods"** by Barbara Moser-Mercer
- Discusses methods for measuring cognitive load in interpreters
**"The Use of Information Technology in Simultaneous Interpretation"** by Klaus Kaindl
note: - Explores the impact of technology on interpreting practices.

title: **"Simultaneous Interpreting: A Comparative Study of Strategies and Techniques"** by Miriam Shlesinger
- Compares different strategies used by interpreters
**"The Impact of Language Pair on Simultaneous Interpreting"** by Ingrid Kurz (1992) - Examines how different language pairs affect interpreting strategies
**"Simultaneous Interpreting: Training and Practice"** by Andrew Gillies
- Focuses on training methods for simultaneous interpreters
**"The Role of Memory in Simultaneous Interpreting"** by Daniel Gile
note: - Investigates the memory processes involved in interpreting.

title: **"Simultaneous Interpreting: A Multidisciplinary Approach"** by Franz Pöchhacker
- Offers a multidisciplinary perspective on interpreting
**"The Use of Machine Translation in Simultaneous Interpreting"** by Spence Green et al
- Discusses the integration of machine translation in interpreting
**"Simultaneous Interpreting: Challenges and Solutions"** by Barbara Moser-Mercer
- Identifies common challenges and potential solutions in the field
**"The Effect of Speed on Simultaneous Interpreting"** by Ingrid Kurz
- Analyzes how speech speed impacts interpreting performance
**"Simultaneous Interpreting: A Cognitive Approach"** by Daniel Gile (2008) - Explores cognitive theories related to interpreting
**"The Role of Context in Simultaneous Interpreting"** by Franz Pöchhacker
- Discusses how context influences interpreting decisions
**"Simultaneous Interpreting: A Review of Recent Research"** by Miriam Shlesinger
- Reviews recent studies and findings in the field
**"Advances in Simultaneous Interpreting Technology"** by Barry Slaughter Olsen
- Looks at technological advancements and their implications for interpreters
